body: Ok! Listen up. Am I the only one who is confused why sexual and all that shit songs are allowed? Sooo... Why is it allowed?

Sooo... Why is it allowed?

replies.body: It's unfair to kids. Having to hear 14-19 year olds playing sexual songs that they don't need to hear. I stand by my point of that there is not a valid reason for this to be allowed. Don't just say to kids "leave". Maybe they wanna hear appropriate music and not get kicked out for some immature teenager playing stupid songs. As much fun as you may think it is you try looking at it from others perspectives. Why the hell would we want this on our server? It makes the server look like a bunch of immature brats trying to look cool with their "amazing" songs. Imaging if some guy was to come on the ts and go to music room and see everyone singing/playing sexual/racist songs. I wonder what they would think.

replies.body: The community comprises almost entirely people under eighteen years of age; I don't see how this is unfair to "kids". Regardless, nothing about it is "unfair" anyway; by participating in a public music channel in which the participants themselves and their musical preferences determine what gets played, you run the risk of hearing things you don't like or don't want to hear because not everyone shares the same likes and opinions (a general statement that applies to more than this particular situation). In this case, those "things" would be these "inappropriate songs" you're so distressed about — the hearing of which, I feel, is to be expected considering how much of the more popular music in contemporary society is obscene. Because songs like those are so mainstream, my belief is that people who join the music channel and hear this music being played either don't mind it, expect it, or perceive it to be relatively normal (which it is). Personally, I very much dislike most modern music — especially the music you seem to have issues with — but there's nothing I can do about it. Ultimately, as already stated, the rules allow it, and the majority of the community is fine with that.
replies.body_tagged: The community comprises almost entirely people under eighteen years of age; I don't see how this is unfair to "kids". Regardless, nothing about it is "unfair" anyway; by participating in a public music channel in which the participants themselves and their musical preferences determine what gets played, you run the risk of hearing things you don't like or don't want to hear because not everyone shares the same likes and opinions (a general statement that applies to more than this particular situation). In this case, those "things" would be these "inappropriate songs" you're so distressed about — the hearing of which, I feel, is to be expected considering how much of the more popular music in contemporary society is obscene. Because songs like those are so mainstream, my belief is that people who join the music channel and hear this music being played either don't mind it, expect it, or perceive it to be relatively normal (which it is). Personally, I very much dislike most modern music — especially the music you seem to have issues with — but there's nothing I can do about it. Ultimately, as already stated, the rules allow it, and the majority of the community is fine with that.
